availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Newton Dysard (Greenup County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Son of Issac Newton Dysard, Sr. and Oliva Crump Dysard. Married to Arminta Dysard. Father of William Dysard, Elizabeth Dysard, and Edward Dysard. Laborer in Greenup County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Greenup County in 1860. Employed Robert Stevens as a day laborer in Greenup County in 1860. Served in the 54th Kentucky Mounted Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from September 5, 1864 to September 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 255A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, East Little Sandy, p. 844.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Precinct 1, p. 25A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 516.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016207, Greenup County Deaths, File #17765.
Find A Grave, “Isaac N Dysard (1828-unknown),” Memorial #81736361, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81736361 (accessed December 21, 2017).
